name: The Six Faced War Machines
description:
Cast your dice into the field of battle...

The Six Eyed War Machines is a unique twist on the tower defence genre, wherein you aim and shoot explosive animitronic dice at oncoming hordes or deathbots. We drew inspiration from RTS games like starcraft, as well as aiming mechanics from games such as Angry Birds or Peggle. Its a hard-to-master fusion of dissimilar yet strangely harmonious genres that we really hope you'll enjoy!

Instructions (The game does not have a tutorial. PLEASE READ)

- click and drag on occupied towers to launch your explosive dice-mechs at your foes.

- left-click to select dice in the field, and right click to move them towards your mouse.

- if you move a dice-mech to one of the towers, it will mount itself in the tower.

- don't let the enemies reach your base! If your health reaches zero, you lose!

- Survive all six waves to win!

Tips:

- Your dice-mechs automatically shoot at nearby enemies, but their guns are slow and weak.

- Dice-mechs launched from towers roll until they come to a stop and then release a powerful AOE attack for their top face value.

- Dice mounted in towers can still shoot, and they get a small bonus to their range. 

- Dice mechs are vulnerable to counterattack from enemies when not mounted in towers. 

- If your dice die, do not dispair! They'll respawn at your base.
